thread.title: Carpool Karaoke at Grammys: Beyonce's daughter Blue Ivy 'saves the day' for James Corden in star-studded performance
thread.title_full: Carpool Karaoke at Grammys: Beyonce's daughter Blue Ivy 'saves the day' for James Corden in star-studded performance

author: Chris Graham
title: Carpool Karaoke at Grammys: Beyonce's daughter Blue Ivy 'saves the day' for James Corden in star-studded performance
text:
Carpool Karaoke at Grammys: Beyonce's daughter Blue Ivy 'saves the day' for James Corden in star-studded performance James Corden, with Blue Ivy (left) and Jennifer Lopez (right), among others Credit: Getty Chris Graham 13 February 2017 • 5:28am 
J ames Corden had played down rumours that he would include a Carpool Karaoke segment during the Grammy Awards, saying he didn't have time. 
But what he lacked in minutes, the evening's host made up for with star power - and a cameo from a rather famous five-year-old. 
The night's compere was joined by a number of top singers for the skit, a recurrent segment on The Late Late Show , which sees the host picking up stars and driving them around while they chat and sing along to the car stereo. 
Corden kicked off the segment by donning a cardboard cut-out of a car, joking the organisers had insisted he wear it to remind viewers who he was. #GRAMMYs : @JKCorden brings Neil Diamond, @JLo , @JohnLegend and Blue Ivy together for 'Sweet Caroline' Carpool Karaoke. pic.twitter.com/l1OMtNdfeH — Hollywood Reporter (@THR) February 13, 2017 
J ennifer Lopez was first to join him in the routine, the second time she had taken part in the skit. In March last year, J-Lo sat in the passenger seat as the pair belted out lines from her hits Love Don't Cost a Thing, Booty and Jenny from the Block - and at one point Corden gets hold of her phone and sends a joke text to Leonardo DiCaprio. 
Joining her for the Grammys segment were John Legend, Faith Hill, Keith Urban and Neil Diamond. The chosen song was Diamond's Sweet Caroline, though Hill and Legend didn't seem too sure of the lyrics. 
Stealing the show at the end was Beyonce's daughter Blue Ivy. Wearing a pink suit in a tribute to Prince, the five-year-old ran over to join in and arguably saved the day. Blue Ivy just saved that Carpool bit. #GRAMMYs — Katelyn Tarver (@katelyntarver) February 13, 2017 Still not over Blue Ivy's act of charity tonight in rescuing Carpool Karaoke. #GRAMMYs — Elaine L. (@LaineyGossip) February 13, 2017 Greatest performance of the night so far was #BlueIvy in the Carpool Karaoke. And she didn't even sing. #GRAMMYs — SHE Canada (@SHECanada) February 13, 2017 Blue Ivy running over all excited at the very end is the cutest #GRAMMYs https://t.co/DVN8yrEJ1y — Aaron Vallely (@Vallmeister) February 13, 2017 
C orden also got a little help from his parents during the evening. The host pretended to be furious as he found his mother and father , Margaret and Malcolm Corden, cosying up to their "free pass" partners - Heidi Klum and Nick Jonas! James Corden’s Mom Dad Snuggle With Nick Jonas Heidi Klum At … : https://t.co/rAxOKU8p12 .,, pic.twitter.com/U44ySYgbBX — Kaylee Smith (@Smith1Kaylee) February 13, 2017 Follow Telegraph Music
